intro: Actinostemon macrocarpus, commonly known as the large-fruited actinostemon, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by bracts, which can be brightly colored. Its fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. Actinostemon macrocarpus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
